website_summaries.verdict: This 30-pack of 13-gallon bags allows users to feel good about their purchase, as the bags are partially made of recycled materials.
pros: Bags are partly made of recycled materials, making this a environmentally friendly purchase
Backed by brand known for environmental consciousness
These reliably prevent leaks and tears

customer_reviews.title: Seventh Generation now owned by Unilever, a company that tests on animals!
customer_reviews.text: Seventh Generation was bought by Unilever last year. Unilever is on the list of companies that tests on animals. As a long time vegan who seeks cruelty free, vegan products and companies, it is sad to see a company like Seventh Generation bought by a company like Unilever. It is deceptive of them to list their products as "not tested on animals". Maybe the Seventh Generation line isn't, but the fact that it is under the umbrella of Unilever opens the door for them to do just that, test Seventh Generation products on animals, and people will not know. I will not purchase Seventh Generation anymore.
customer_reviews.author: melquist

customer_reviews.title: Horrible bags, Not worth the trash I would have liked to put in them.
customer_reviews.text: The first ten or so I tried to use were just flat sheets of plastic after spending a half hour trying to unfold them. They were not sealed at the edges. I finally gave up and threw the remainder in the trash in a better brand bag.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: So Frustrating
customer_reviews.text: Thin and poorly made. It's a shame when your trying to be eco-conscious and you run into products like this. Almost everytime we take out the trash we end up rebagging all the trash that ripped through the bottom of the first bag. Even double bagging is not a guarantee that a blow-out will not occur. YUCK! It's so frustrating, not to mention, such a waste to have to double bag everytime. We will not be buying these again, but somehow need to find a way to use all 12 boxes. Suggestions???
customer_reviews.author: Adrielle

customer_reviews.title: Beeen using them for years
customer_reviews.text: However, we just switched to a 20 gallon trash can because we don't generate that much trash as it's just me and my wife (and three dogs). These 33 gallon bags are overkill now but we've been happy with them for years and with the Seventh Generation products in general. I've done some searching though and finding a 20 gallon trash bag is a challenge. The only thing suitable I could find was a trash compactor bag. If anybody can recommend a trash bag for 20 gallon cans, please feel free to chime in with a comment. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Grossman

customer_reviews.title: The bags are strong and I am pleased with the product
customer_reviews.text: The bags are strong and I am pleased with the product. Feel better knowing that the product uses recycled content.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Just right!
customer_reviews.text: They are strong and a perfect size for my tall kitchen trash can.
customer_reviews.author: HB

customer_reviews.title: Good for light to medium duty
customer_reviews.text: I generally love Seventh Generation products. It feels good to buy products that are environmentally friendly, from a company that is responsible. However, these trash bags are not their best item. They are thin and rip easily. I use them only in our diaper pail. (We use Seventh Generation diapers as well, which I highly recommend!) The bags will hold a medium heavy load, as long as you don't have a lot of sharp edges in the bag. The best part about these bags is knowing that they are made from recycled plastic, which is good for our landfills.
customer_reviews.author: ltnbrn

customer_reviews.title: "feel better" trash bags
customer_reviews.text: Short of giving up trash can liners altogether, these are the next best thing. They fit well enough into my Simple Human 50L trash can (an excellent trash can, btw!). They are not as thick as the ones that can with the trash can, and I do kind of have to stretch the opening a little to get it over the edges--if I'm not careful, the bag can tear. But though they seem a little delicate, I've never lost one. One of them lasts a whole week in the kitchen, and none has ever torn when removing to replace. I'm especially happy because of they are made of 100% recycled, 70% post-consumer plastic!
customer_reviews.author: N. Corwyn

customer_reviews.title: Trash
customer_reviews.text: They are literally garbage. They tear so easy. You cant fill them 3/4 full or you won't be able to get them out of the garage can.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholle Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Defective shipment
customer_reviews.text: Usually we love these bags, but these ones were defective. They were weirdly sealed at the top, and have to be torn open, which often ruins the whole bag. 😤
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Worst Garbage bags EVER!
customer_reviews.text: These things are so flimsy that they tear along the seams when you are merely opening them. I even tried double bagging and I still had a mess on my floor. I want to be environmentally responsible but the product has to actually WORK! These do not. Run, don't walk from this product. Waste of money AND resources.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Jo Little

customer_reviews.title: better choice
customer_reviews.text: These bags work fine, and since they use recycled plastic, are a better choice environmentally than the big commercial brands. I also like that they have NO ADDED SCENT! Buying by the case brings the cost down considerably.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Frankel

customer_reviews.title: OK.  Biggest thing they are green.
customer_reviews.text: These are just like regular trash bags. They don't have the convienent little handle cord, and they aren't especially thick, but they work fine for light household work. I am trusting they are less harmful to the planet, so that makes me feel better about using any sort of plastic, convenience product.
customer_reviews.author: JOB

customer_reviews.title: good trash bags
customer_reviews.text: These were purchased under the premise of being compostable, biodegradable bags. But even though it is listed on Amazon as such, when you receive the box, there is no such indication. These are not compostable, and cannot be used in the city of Seattle for food waste/compost. They are however, good trash bags.
customer_reviews.author: JFGS

customer_reviews.title: False advertising
customer_reviews.text: As B. Scott said, the description on the amazon page and the actual product don't match. I bought these ones specifically compared to another seventh generation trash bag because it said it was made of 100% recycled material. The box specifically says it's only 55% recycled material with only 16% post consumer content (compared to the stated 100% recycled material and 70% post consumer).
customer_reviews.author: Kameron

customer_reviews.title: These bags are fine
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what all the fuss is about...so they're not hefty bags, don't overload them. What would people rather have...a clean planet or a stronger garbage bag? You decide. Ive used them for 3 years with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Kati A.

customer_reviews.title: 7th Generation Trash Bags
customer_reviews.text: We purchased these 7th Generation Trash bags on an trial basis. They are a very good product, don't tear (unless you over load them), are good for our world and have proven to be cost effective when compared to other trash bags.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Item Still Doesn't Match Description
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a case of these expecting 100% recycled content. This is not what I received. When I called Amazon they said this had already been reported but they failed to do anything about it. Reading the reviews I now see that this issue was called to their attention in 2007! That's a long time to ignore copy mistakes! They gave me a $20 credit for my time and promised to correct their errors but I say buyer beware and read the fine print!
customer_reviews.author: Melaine Bales

customer_reviews.title: Recycled plastic! GREAT if you don't overload!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE having a product that contains so much recycled plastic! Complete the recycling loop! These bags can't hold up to overloading, but for ordinary kitchen use, they are great. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Peregrinn

customer_reviews.title: Earth friendly Kitchen Trash Bags
customer_reviews.text: Fit well and have yet to have one break. No annoying smell like the previous biodegradable ones I bought. Best of all by buying by the case they last me all year!
customer_reviews.author: Bargain Bethli

customer_reviews.title: open easily and plenty strong
customer_reviews.text: No odor, fit the trash can, open easily and plenty strong.
customer_reviews.author: Sharlene

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: If I am going to use disposable products I want to use something that is kinder to the environment. And Seventh Generation products do it. These trash bags work pretty well. They are a little thin, so I am always afraid they are going to rip. But they haven't ripped yet. So it is good.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Katsavavakis

customer_reviews.title: Love Seventh Generation!
customer_reviews.text: These were even better than the last case I got. The last case sometimes the bags were a little thin to hold items that had a hard edge to them. These bags are thicker. I wish it was compostable plastic, but I like that they are made with recycled plastic. Thank you :0)
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Prior

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as the others!
customer_reviews.text: Just ordered a case and am very happy with these bags. Have used both Member's Mark (Sam's Club) and GFS brand kitchen bags and I can't tell the difference.
customer_reviews.author: newly green

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price and "GREEN"
customer_reviews.text: I've used these bags for over a year. They are pretty good bags if you don't overstuff. They do tear, but I've never had one break.
customer_reviews.author: reg221

customer_reviews.title: 7th Generation tall kitchen bags
customer_reviews.text: These kitchen trash bags are made from recycled material plastic (55%). I incorrectly assumed they were also biodegradeable. After contacting 7th Generation, they are NOT biodegradeable. I now have alot of them and they are good bags, just not what I thought.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Would've been happy with a quarter of that amount
customer_reviews.text: There were so many damn boxes of bags. Would've been happy with a quarter of that amount. But grateful for this brand
customer_reviews.author: CBurdine

customer_reviews.title: kitchen trash bags
customer_reviews.text: These trash bags are a great product. They are strong, easy to handle and tie, and better for the environment than some other bags.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Wade

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I use these for anything that isn't the tall kitchen trash can. No handles and these will work in the kitchen trash can, but harder to keep them from slipping off the sides. Great for other clean up projects and trash that needs to be taken out more frequently. Useful for that tall kitchen trash when I run out of the named brand bags.
customer_reviews.author: NJG

customer_reviews.title: Week seams.
customer_reviews.text: I was Very disappointed with these trash bags. I normally use the seventh generation cleaning products, but these bags were AWFUL. The bags split at the seams very easily resulting in a huge mess in my kitchen! I only have an 8gallon trash can, and the bags were NOT over filled. The construction was not what I would expect from a normally reliable company. I bought these off AMAZON for roughly the same price I pay for our regular brand of trash bag. I was hoping to make our house a little 'greener'. Having to double bag every load of trash makes these bags a much more expensive item.
customer_reviews.author: StayathomeMom

customer_reviews.title: Really like these
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using these for a year. Thwart are durable, no scent and easy to tie for removal.
customer_reviews.author: Myzenbox

customer_reviews.title: New and improved
customer_reviews.text: I am happy to purchase anything that is a greener option. I believe these were redesigned...they now have tie-tabs to tie the bags together. Before it was just your standard bag with four straight sides, and it was very difficult to get the bag open. Now there is no guessing which is the right side to open. On a side note, I have purchased the drawstring version and they are (pun intended) garbage! Ripped under the string so many times.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Rip off!
customer_reviews.text: Product is defective. Seals in the bottom of the bags are not patent! I have to check each bag to make sure it's seal is in tact. Sometimes It doesn't matter they break and who wants to save a dirty trash bag fir returns. Save your money!
customer_reviews.author: B. Manuel

customer_reviews.title: Fine for the lighter items tear far too easily though and forget anything heavy...
customer_reviews.text: These tear far to easily, they hardly even handle my recycling bin at home, and normal garbage is far too much for these bags. Still I plan to make it work until I have used them all up but don't count on them for the anything substantial (in size or weight as both things tend to tear or split open these garbage bags). I don't plan on buying these again.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

customer_reviews.title: Large garbage bags
customer_reviews.text: These are garbage bags. They are the perfect sized for our kitchen simplehuman 30 liter can. Yes, the 30 _gallon_ bags are perfect for the 30 _liter_ can. The smaller, white "tall kitchen bags" that Seven gen has were too small for it. They come with twist ties. Have a good place to store the 12 boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Is it really better for the Earth?
customer_reviews.text: They are trash bags. The fact that it is Seventh Generation eases my conscious, but I am not sure that there is actually anything about these that make them more Earth friendly than another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jess B

customer_reviews.title: ecoperson
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Not as heavy as your non eco products, but if your using for regular everyday trash they are fine. I have used with heavy items and as long as there was no sharp items, they worked fine. Give them a try I think you will be pleasantly surprised. And, you will be helping the environment.
customer_reviews.author: PattiB

customer_reviews.title: Seventh Generation Trash Bags
customer_reviews.text: These bags are great! I don't know why there are all these questionable reviews about the quality of these bags. Granted, I have always purchased the inexpensive kitchen trash bags at Target or wherever, but these are perfectly comparable (or even better quality)! They are more than sufficient for our needs, and I imagine the average household's needs. They work just as they are supposed to, and they are great for the environment. Buy them.
customer_reviews.author: jp

customer_reviews.title: Great green garbage bags!
customer_reviews.text: Sure, they are a little pricey but they are just as excellent as any other brand and far far better for the environment. Even if you aren't a person who buys into global warming or whatever, it should be pretty obvious that creating less waste isn't a bad thing...
customer_reviews.author: J. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Good for the Earth and Great for my family
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried that the quality would not be as good, but I have been proven wrong again and again. They are as durable as the Target brand bags that I used to buy. Considering we only use 1 bag per week, cost is not an issue. However, this price on Amazon is the best I've found. Love these bags because they are made with recycled material. I will continue to buy and use them.
customer_reviews.author: Dearborn Mama

customer_reviews.title: the tabs are easy to work with
customer_reviews.text: Works well, the tabs are easy to work with, even though I prefer a drawstring closure.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith M

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality, So Thin They Break
customer_reviews.text: We just arranged return on case we bought. In normal usage, not heavy items, we've seen five bags break in first package used -- 2 bursting on kitchen floor, before we threw in the towel. The bags are thin, and thinner than other bio bags we've bought, and used for two years, without breakage. These Seventh Generation bags aren't ready for sale; they need the seams strengthened.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Doctor

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that these bags are made with a high percentage of recycled material. However, they are thin and tear very easily. I ended up putting less content in them and therefore using more bags than the ones I used previously. I am quite disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: C. M. K.

customer_reviews.title: Amazimg for enviroment
customer_reviews.text: Great bags, just don't stuff with trash, it's for the earth, we all live here, our food included.
customer_reviews.author: InpizzaWeCrust

customer_reviews.title: Thin but they do the job
customer_reviews.text: I had hoped these would be a little thicker (thus 4 rather than 5 stars), but they seem to be working okay. They also have a faint, pleasant scent - vanilla perhaps?
customer_reviews.author: Dr. G

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine
customer_reviews.text: As others have stated, I wouldnt try to overstuff these bags, but then again, I would never overstuff any trash bag not specifically made for heavy duty loads. I have used these bags now for four weeks, each full of a weeks worth of trash, and have had no breakage or tearing problems, nor have any torn when the trash men come to pick it up and throw it in the truck. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Fanny's Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Great, but a few more than enough
customer_reviews.text: I have been having trouble getting these at my local stores, so was glad to find them on line. I might have wished the case had half as many boxes in it, but they will get used eventually.
customer_reviews.author: V1

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as old design
customer_reviews.text: The previous bags I ordered had a drawstring top. These have a twist tie closing. I probabably won't be ordering any more.
customer_reviews.author: N. J. Powell

customer_reviews.title: Good Green Product
customer_reviews.text: The have never broken and have been our choice for years.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Kilgore

customer_reviews.title: Great bags
customer_reviews.text: I've been on auto-delivery for some time now. The bags are fairly strong and the price is great. Also a plus in helping our environment.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Work just fine and we are contributing...
customer_reviews.text: These bags work very well, they are just as strong as the best we've used, and much better than the cheap ones. They were similarly priced or less than any other bags, and we bought a case, since they are a staple item. With free shiping (Amazon Prime) they cost the same or less and they are recycled. This is simply a good thing all the way around... We will do it again. We bought a case of the paper towels as well... I would provide a similar review for them.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H. Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy, easily breaks
customer_reviews.text: These trash bags are wimpy. I wish I'd returned them sooner; they are a hassle and have frequently broken en route to the trash dump. Not fun.
customer_reviews.author: Karin JHK

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Assume they really are enviro-friendly and they work just fine. No tears using them for routine household/kitchen garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Domestic gnome

customer_reviews.title: Gargage bags
customer_reviews.text: I like they they are recycled and price is comparable to normal grocery store prices. They are a little flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: P. RobbinsTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Holey
customer_reviews.text: Cheap bags, about a quarter of them can't be used due to holes in them right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: BrandonScott

customer_reviews.title: Bad Bags - Don't Bother
customer_reviews.text: These are really poorly made bags. They are ultra thin, which means you have to double them up if you don't want a rip. They don't tie well because they are so thin, they rip when you try to cinch them. I bought a case and now wonder what I am going to do with all of these bad bags. I want to be environmentally friendly, but these bags just aren't worth the frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Love Recycled Plastic
customer_reviews.text: These are useful and green. They carry medium weights fine - normal kitchen waste. Glad bags won't leave you feeling like you helped the environment. Seventh Genaration will.
customer_reviews.author: Mel S. Stark

customer_reviews.title: Awesome trash bags
customer_reviews.text: These trash bags dont rip, tear or have any issues. They hold everything. I love them and have used them for a few years now. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay K. Farley

customer_reviews.title: just a trash bag
customer_reviews.text: Not very strong...like the idea of recycling though, but there are others out there that are less expensive and the same in other ways.
customer_reviews.author: Katecory

customer_reviews.title: Great, buy them to save money and the environment
customer_reviews.text: Great product, cheaper than the big brands and so much better for the environment. Why would anyone choose anything else?
customer_reviews.author: Lizzy

customer_reviews.title: product good but all the boxes came dented and banged up ...
customer_reviews.text: product good but all the boxes came dented and banged up and looked like they were open. need better packaging even though trash bags wont get damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl T

product_meta.title: Seventh Generation Trash Bags, Tall Kitchen, 13-Gallon, 30-Count Boxes (Pack of 12)
product_meta.description:
Size:30 Count (Pack of 12)| Style:Tall KitchenSeventh Generation Tall Kitchen Trash Bags are made with 55% recycled plastic with 16% post-consumer recycled plastic. If every household in the U.S. replaced just one package of 15 count large trash bags made from virgin plastic, we could save: 93,000 barrels of oil, enough to heat and cool 5,300 U.S. homes for a year: 1.7 million cubic feet of landfill space, equal to 2,500 full garbage trucks and: avoid 34,600 tons of pollution!

AMAZON.COM
When trash is unavoidable, choose recyclable plastic trash bags. Seventh Generation Trash Bags are a more sustainable choice for your home and the planet. Protecting Planet Home At Seventh Generation, we know your home is your world. For the past 20 years, it's been our mission to help you protect your world with our environmentally responsible and effective household products. By choosing Seventh Generation household products, you create a healthy environment for you and your family.
feature_bullets: Gencore 3-layer technology, premium durability ideal for kitchen waste
More sustainable choice than trash bags from 100% virgin plastic

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
